Given your preference for drama and John Malkovich, I'd highly recommend "Velvet Goldmine" (1998). This intriguing movie stars Christian Bale and Eddie Izzard in a story about the glam rock scene of the 1970s. If you enjoy mysteries intertwined with music and drama, this could be right up your alley!

Another film that might catch your interest is "The White Countess" (2005), starring Natasha Richardson and Ralph Fiennes. Set in 1930s Shanghai, it's a captivating tale of a former Russian aristocrat who forms an unusual relationship with a blind diplomat. This movie offers a unique blend of romance, mystery, and historical drama. Enjoy the exploration!

These films offer insightful stories about human resilience amidst war and conflict.
